DataElement.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Concentration Score 5 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Person's stated observation of the degree of distress they experience related to their concentration, using a five-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms._A question about whether an individual is or was able to concentrate._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Concepts.definition: A patient reported questionnaire composed of rating scales developed to measure the degree of distress experienced by the patient for specific symptoms.

Property.preferredDefinition: A question about whether an individual is or was able to concentrate.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual is or was able to concentrate.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Symptom Distress Scale Concentration Score 5 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Numeric scores from 1 (I have my normal ability to concentrate) to 5 (I just can't seem to concentrate at all) on a Likert scale used on the Symptom Distress Scale questionnaire.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I just can't seem to concentrate at all

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I just can't seem to concentrate at all
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual just can't seem to concentrate at all.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual just can't seem to concentrate at all.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I usually have considerable difficulty concentrating

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I usually have considerable difficulty concentrating
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual usually has or had considerable difficulty concentrating.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual usually has or had considerable difficulty concentrating.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I occasionally have considerable trouble concentrating

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I occasionally have considerable trouble concentrating
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had considerable trouble concentrating.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had considerable trouble concentrating.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had trouble concentrating.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual occasionally has or had trouble concentrating.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: I have my normal ability to concentrate

ValueMeaning.preferredName: I have my normal ability to concentrate
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had their normal ability to concentrate.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual has or had their normal ability to concentrate.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure.  The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents.  Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: SDS User's Manual
ReferenceDocuments.description: Documentation of the development, method of administration,  scoring procedures and psychometric properties of the SDS.
